alert.note: Alert for Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 24 at 6:11AM AKDT until March 27 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow with low visibility at times. Additional snow accumulations of two inches and one half mile or less at times. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow and blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 12 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. Low visibility is possible. * WHERE...Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 PM AKDT this afternoon. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Saturday evening through late Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible Saturday night and Sunday. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Snow drifts will form. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and blowing snow will taper off Friday afternoon. Heavy snow is expected to develop Saturday evening and continue through Sunday night. Strong winds on Saturday night and Sunday could cause blizzard conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
